TextView.android:text: Interfacing with your\nown remote full Sia node

Estimated setup time: 3-5 minutes.\nDetailed below is how to set up Sia on your Windows computer so that you can use Sia Mobile with it. If you're using Linux, it's assumed you are capable of adapting these instructions to Linux. It is possible to use an existing Sia installation; skip to step 3 in this case.

1. Download the zip file for the latest Sia release for your platform at https://github.com/NebulousLabs/Sia/releases. This is the bare minimum for running a full Sia node on your computer to use with Sia Mobile. If you want a graphical interface on your computer for your walletModel and files as well, instead download Sia-UI from here: https://github.com/NebulousLabs/Sia-UI/releases.
2. Extract the zip file to a location of your choosing.

3. Navigate within the Sia folder until you are in the directory that contains siad. If you instead downloaded Sia-UI in step 1, siad will be buried in resources > app > Sia. Open a command prompt in this directory by pressing Alt+d, typing cmd, and pressing enter.
4. In the command prompt, type ipconfig and press enter. Note the number next to 'IP Address'. This is your computer's internal IP address. You will need this later.
6. When prompted for an API password, enter one of your choosing. Remember your password for later.
7. Open the settings page in Sia Mobile. Tap 'Remote node address', and enter the IP address and port that you used to start Sia on your computer earlier. Do the same with 'API password'.

If done correctly, your Sia Mobile will now be functional. If you have not already created a walletModel on your Sia installation, navigate to the Wallet page of Sia Mobile, open the top-right menu, and select Create Wallet. Enter your desired password and then press Create. After creating a walletModel, it is important to keep your walletModel seed somewhere safe. To myView your walletModel seed, access the same menu, and select View Seeds.
Note that it might take a significant amount of time for Sia on your computer to sync with the rest of the Sia network. This is normal, and is not the fault of Sia Mobile.
